body_html:
After tf.train.import_meta_graph the variables will be in the collections, so [v for v in tf.get_default_graph().get_colection(tf.GraphKeys.GLOBAL_VARIABLES) if v.name == my_variable_name]
…
On Thu, Nov 15, 2018 at 4:35 PM Sambhav Jain ***@***.***> wrote: Okay. And after importing the metagraph in a session, how does one grab a variable_def using its variable name? Can you please provide a short example? *Import metagraph:* with tf.Session() as sess: new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph('my-save-dir/my-model-10000.meta') new_saver.restore(sess, 'my-save-dir/my-model-10000') *Restore variable python object:* variable_name = "my_var" variable_def = ?? my_var = tf.Variable.from_proto(variable_def) — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#23591 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAATxVjkPpU-_q-cTow5mlpiReozUubTks5uvgg1gaJpZM4YTzTj> .
-- - Alex
body_text:
After tf.train.import_meta_graph the variables will be in the collections,
so [v for v in
tf.get_default_graph().get_colection(tf.GraphKeys.GLOBAL_VARIABLES) if
v.name == my_variable_name]
…
On Thu, Nov 15, 2018 at 4:35 PM Sambhav Jain ***@***.***> wrote:
 Okay. And after importing the metagraph in a session, how does one grab a
 variable_def using its variable name? Can you please provide a short
 example?

 *Import metagraph:*

 with tf.Session() as sess:
   new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph('my-save-dir/my-model-10000.meta')
   new_saver.restore(sess, 'my-save-dir/my-model-10000')

 *Restore variable python object:*

 variable_name = "my_var"
 variable_def = ??
 my_var = tf.Variable.from_proto(variable_def)

 —

body:
After tf.train.import_meta_graph the variables will be in the collections,
so [v for v in
tf.get_default_graph().get_colection(tf.GraphKeys.GLOBAL_VARIABLES) if
v.name == my_variable_name]

On Thu, Nov 15, 2018 at 4:35 PM Sambhav Jain <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Okay. And after importing the metagraph in a session, how does one grab a
> variable_def using its variable name? Can you please provide a short
> example?
>
> *Import metagraph:*
>
> with tf.Session() as sess:
>   new_saver = tf.train.import_meta_graph('my-save-dir/my-model-10000.meta')
>   new_saver.restore(sess, 'my-save-dir/my-model-10000')
>
> *Restore variable python object:*
>
> variable_name = "my_var"
> variable_def = ??
> my_var = tf.Variable.from_proto(variable_def)
>
> —
